meanings.definition: A person who has recently arrived in a place or joined a group.
meanings.sent1: The newcomers in our class are still learning their way around the school.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood welcomed the newcomers with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The newcomers at the party were so lost they ended up in the backyard playing with the dog.
meanings.sent4: The city embraced the newcomers like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The newcomers brought a sense of excitement and energy to the community.

meanings.definition: A new participant in an activity or organization.
meanings.sent1: The newcomers in the chess club quickly learned the rules and strategies.
meanings.sent2: The team was happy to have new newcomers join their soccer practice.
meanings.sent3: The newcomers at the book club meeting were so eager they started reading out loud.
meanings.sent4: The company saw the newcomers as fresh blood bringing new ideas and perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The newcomers injected a sense of vitality and enthusiasm into the group.
